text: Tempat yang nyaman dan mempunyai kualitas makanan yang enak. Memiliki bar yang asik untuk nongki. Mempunnyai pemandangan yang dapat memanjakan mata. Pelayanan yang baik. Sangat rekomended sekali untuk datang ke morabito.
title: Sangat memuaskan

text:
Tempat ini sangat indah dan memukau, orang-orangnya bersahabat, dan lokasi penginapannya sempurna.
Ya memang agak sedikit mahal, akan tetapi tempat ini benar-benar suatu KEMEWAHAN!!! Setiap rupiah begitu berharga!
Tempat ini merupakan salah satu yang teraman dan terbaik yang dapat Anda temukan untuk menginap di Bali (jadi saya pikir tarifnya masuk akal). Ini merupakan tempat yang menakjubkan untuk mengadakan suatu acara (seperti pernikahan... pernikahan yang mereka selenggarakan sangat berkesan).
Makanan di sini lezat dan ranjangnya sangat nyaman. Taman di sini seperti sebuah mimpi, saya dapat menghabiskan sepanjang hari berkeliling di dalamnya.
title: Tiada hal lainnya selain puncak kemewahan

text:
Saya cukup beruntung bisa menginap dua malam di Morabitos. Vilanya luar biasa indah, campuran yang sempurna dari desain arsitektur modern dan nuansa serta dekorasi Bali. Taman bunga vila ini pada dasarnya terletak di pantai, dan dilengkapi dengan furnitur nyaman modern yang berwarna gelap yang mana di sana Anda bisa membaca buku atau menatap lautan. Saya juga sangat menikmati nuansa kreatif dari lokasi ini. Vila ini dibangun sehubungan dengan tanaman lokal, yang berarti bahwa ada beberapa pohon palem yang disediakan di dalam rumah, dimulai di lantai pertama dan menyebarkan daun-daunnya di teras atas: hal ini adalah salah satu detail yang membuat tempat ini unik. Kebaikan dari tuan rumah saya, selalu siap mendiskusikan seni mereka dan memberi Anda masukan mengenai tempat-tempat menarik di sekitar, dan kehadiran diam-diam para staf, yang tampaknya berada di sini hanya untuk memenuhi setiap kebutuhan Anda bahkan sebelum Anda memikirkannya, telah membuat penginapan saya di vila mewah ini menjadi suatu peristirahatan yang menyenangkan dan menenangkan selama perjalanan saya di Bali.
Saya akan merekomendasikan tempat ini kepada siapapun yang ingin untuk menghindari rutinitas harinnya selama beberapa hari.
title: Dua hari di surga

photos.caption: View from in front of my room

text: Very special hotel. Each room in a different theme mit original art articles or ancient indonesian artifacts. The best is the location right in the heart of Berawa directly at the beach front. Even just 50 m away from Finns beach club the spot is very quiet.
title: Quiet place in the perfect location

text: Just an amazing 3 nights spent in the DH Suite, within this absolutely out of this world place. You just have the feeling to be a highly privileged guest. Nothing we could request to make it better, we just had everything. Lucky also to have met the famous owner and his wife, sharing a little bit of their passion, enthusiasm, and incredible experience. The suite, the place, the spot...just unique.
title: Out of this world

text:
Having been to Bali numerous times, we decided to explore lesser known Canggu.  

We found Morabito Art Villa and was initially perturbed by the vastly differences in reviews. Some smashed it down consistently which is weird because it seemed written by one person, mostly others are full of praises.

We followed our instinct n stayed here for 2 nights.  

And we were right... this is possibly our best vacation. 

Located in Berawa Beach famous surf spot in Canggu area,  morabito art villa has the most amazing view of the Indian Ocean.  We had best daily dose of surfers and sunset the moment we  stepped into our balcony! 

With only 14 suites, we seemed to have the vast spaces to ourselves.  We had permission to view some of these suites and were amazed by the individual magical characteristics of each... one had a secret access that brings guest to a secret attic that opens up to the splash of waves.  Another is nestled amongst the massive garden with quirky and beautiful antiques in the suite.  

Be warned though - this is not the typical chain hotel where you get service at press of the button.  But the group of staff served guests with from true Balinese pride.  We felt spoilt and hardly leaves this villa!  Nothing is ever too much for them.  

We met marie and pascal during our stay and was blown away by their hospitality. Marie is such a humble and delightful host who personally served a delightful cup of coffee when we arrived.  

We will surely miss this place and can’t wait to be back again❤️
title: Paradise on earth

text:
Photos on this website are misleading, advertising is a misrepresentation, and the owner is deceptive.

Bed linen is filthy and torn, years of sweat stains compose tie-die like patterns on the pillows.  Junk (sorry, “art” ) strewn around the property is  a tangled unsightly mess gathering webs, dust and vermin. 
Air conditioning units smelled, when they worked.
An unattended garden hose flooded our room, and my friends foot was cut on glass fragments littered in the garden. 
Glass table tops had mould, bird excrement and cracks. Chairs and sofas were broken, damaged and stained. Staff left dirty dishes in common areas unattended for days. 

Most regrettably, Marie, the owner with whom we had been in constant correspondence prior to our arrival, promising us “high level of care and attention to detail” left for France the day before we arrived so our complaints sat with untrained staff until we arrived home. On confronting Marie by email with our disappointment and complaints, we were told we don’t appreciate “art”.

Morabito (Art) Villa advertises “luxury accommodation”  “truly unmatched in terms of quality and style” however their offering is NOT luxury, quality nor style. It is hardly habitable. 

Book somewhere else.
Anywhere else.
title: This neglected, aging property is dirty, smelly and unwelcoming

photos.caption: Bathroom fittings including cracked tiles, mould, and a wooden toothbrush and soap holder that leaves you gagging. Very dirty.

text: After 20 years spent travelling to Bali and staying in genuine, 5 star, spectacular accommodation, I was so looking forward to spending 5 nights at this Villa given I had paid premium money.  The website looked spectacular and the Trip Advisor reviews were complimentary. I paid for exclusive use of the resort but upon arrival found a dirty, run down, overpriced, understaffed and an absolutely morbid place.  The beds were FILTHY (see pics) and my bed was a hard futon mattress full of stains!  Not the king bed I'd been told would be available.  None of the rooms had locks so you did not feel safe or secure. There was no exclusivity about the villa - people were wondering on to the property all the time and staff did nothing.  I caught some creep filming me and my friends around the pool - he was standing on the beach on the edge of the property and I had to get rid of him.  The bedrooms were moldy (see pictures) the bathroom didn't even have a toilet! The staff are untrained and had no interest in us as guests.  There was no manager to supervise them.  The food was below average.   There was two nights where there was NO RUNNING WATER???  Incredible lack of customer care or focus.  The "Art work" was horrific, ugly and covered in dust and filth.  DO NOT WASTE A SINGLE CENT STAYING HERE. We tried again and again to contact the French Manager to voice our disgust at the state of the place but she was overseas and couldn't have cared less about our issues.  We have since tried reaching out again but she will not engage nor consider addressing the complaints made about the poor quality accommodation, run down facilities, untrained and invisible staff.  I would not let my dog stay here - utterly disappointing, disgraceful and completely false advertising of what is on offer.
title: The MOST DISGUSTING PLACE I HAVE EVER BEEN IN BALI

photos.caption: Dirty, stained futon mattress. Not the King Size mattress as promised.  Felt like I was sleeping on an autopsy slab
this was the "secure lock" provided to keep my sliding door closed - there was no lock on the door and it was so scary at night!
The disintegration of the floorboards in my shower - which was covered in mold
The steps into one of the villas was literally rotting away so they just put another board on top - it was unsecured and dangerous.

text:
The worst rooms I have ever been in Bali. Air conditioner not doing what it’s supposed to. Rented for 3 nights but we left after 1 night. My son had so many mosquito bites. 
The so called art is not art in my opinion. Don’t believe the photos online, they are old photos. I was shocked when I arrive, totally different from the photos. The beach is beautiful but the rooms are just very bad. This is a very creepy property which give you goosebumps. Even the staff don’t deny it. They are scared with the “ART” placed in the property. This feels more like “ART” warehouse rather than villa. The staff said tombstones is considered “ART” by the owner. I believe there are some placed in the property. If you want to rent this place, ask the manager to take actual current photos of the rooms first. Don’t just take photos of the bed but around the room. If the owner is reading this, please update the room photos of your villa!! Maybe someone out there appreciates your “ART” but you shouldn’t rent out this property with the current photos.
title: Do not trust their website photos!

owner_response.text:
Hi Jeffrey Suherman,
You were staying at the Canopy suite 2 bedrooms suite with 2 private swimming pool terrasse front ocean view, Master suite of Morabito Art Villa, 600 m2, 6 AC, bathroom, Jacuzzi, Art Collection from Indonesia combined with Modern Art... The suite didn't suit you ? Sorry... 
You came with your friends who ordered a Baby Cot for her child, the baby cot was delivered with a baby mosquito net which perfectly protected the baby. Upon your decision, you didn't ordered a baby cot for your baby, then you complain that your baby was bitten by mosquitoes...
The website www.morabitoartvilla.com as well as the instagram @morabitoartvilla show perfectly well Morabito Art Villa space, rooms, art, garden, location, Living area, suites, sunset, ambiance, food, wedding party, happiness...
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: I stayed at Morabito resort with my girlfriend for a week. This is a small boutique resort, very well located on the beach front. The property is superb, very nice swimming pool, nice restaurant area near the beach, perfect to admire the gorgeous sunsets. The room was gigantic, with the largest bed ever, very confortable. Art work everywhere, traditional Indonesian and modern art, adds a quirky flavour to the place. It is very peaceful, we felt like we had the place to ourselves, perfect romantic getaway! The service is very good, the staff is really friendly and helpful. Several restaurants, bars and cafes nearby. We had a wonderful week, thank you!
title: Beautiful peaceful resort

text:
Hi all, 

I recommend anyone who travels to Bali to stay at this establishment. As my time there was absolutely wonder.  If you want a beautiful place to relax, enjoy art and a terriffic meal, with a beach view.  I am  French and i appriciate savoir vivre to the highest standard.  For the price of this villa is very reasonable.

Regards
Marc L
title: Art Luxury beach

text:
A group of us visited Morabito for drinks. We sat in the tree house, which in itself was a very cool experience, made more amazing by the spectacular sunset view over the ocean and the beautiful surroundings of the Morabito grounds.  The service was excellent and prices reasonable (to give you some context here, much less than Finn’s). 

We didn’t have dinner there but did look at the menu - French inspired but a good selection. Also very reasonable...

The staff very kindly showed us two rooms as we were leaving and we all agreed - the MOST amazing hotel we had ever been into. The owner is an avid collector of antiquities and each room is filled with beautiful objects - art, antique statues, jewellery framed and hanging on the walls. Amazingly beautiful furniture including a hanging king sized bed! Mind blowing!  We saw a room (well more like n apartment) with a rooftop pool... 

This place is well worth a visit. Go for a drink, dinner or stay and do all of the above...
title: Explosion of the senses

text:
A piece of paradise on Berawan Beach
Very secluded, with a beautiful pool, very calm.
Unbelievably decorated with art pieces, everywhere.
The staff and the owners, who are living there, are so welcoming and nice, and contributed to make our stay perfect.
The place to be in Canggu
title: Heaven on earth

text:
I stayed at the Art Cliff (Bingin beach, Bukit) and spent some time with friends at the Art villa (Canggu).
Interior - perfect harmony of eclecticism, gorgeous view to the ocean and surfer lineup (from the Art Cliff).
HUGE recreation territory at the Art villa with clean beach (wery rare for Canggu)
All properties are spotless, which is very rare for Bali.
Staff - polite and responsible (they even managed to find me a 10m extension cable for my video light equipment within 15min).
Both properties (Art Cliff and Art Villa) are ideal scenery for filming and photo shooting (I'm a filmmaker, and the interior and landscape suitability for making perfect compositions was above my expectations).
 
I also had a pleasure to meet with the owners - amazing friendly people.
title: Amazing views and interior

photos.caption: view from Art Cliff, early morning

text: I have spent time both at Morabito Art Villas in Canggu and Morabito Art Cliff in Uluwatu and I cannot say enough good things about both experiences. The properties are absolutely stunning, the owners Pascal and Marie are beautiful, friendly, extremely creative people who have made me and my team feel welcome while we enjoyed our stay and our video shoot. The views on both properties are magnificent and the decor absolutely stunning. The staff are always friendly and helpful and the restaurant in Morabito Canggu has delicious food and juices on the menu.
title: A truly magical place

text: It is seriously one of the most beautiful places I ever stayed. Every small little detail is taken care of with their authentic Art all over. The staff is nice, the food is great and the view never gets old. I like to thank them for the wonderful stay and the sweet hospitality.
title: Morabito Experience

text:
I attended a wedding on April 13th. My friend had booked the whole villa out and paid for the villa and all rooms. Unaware of this, i emailed Marie to ask for accommodation. She offered me 2 rooms and charged me 600 usd per room for 2 nights. I paid her via pay pal. On the day i arrived, me and my family did not have any rooms. Marie refused to reimburse us and in fact did not even come to greet us or speak to us and explain what was happening. She hid in her room all day till 11pm. Finally we met Pascal her husband who was very rude and abusive. (I caught this on video)
They are cheats and i strongly advise against staying at their villa.
title: Terribly Managed

owner_response.text: This is your point of view. The wedding bride ask me that a part of her family from Singapore will pay directly for their stay @morabitoartvilla. You directly booked by email with me the Beach House that we provide you perfectly. Then without understanding what was about your complain, we can only say that you were very stressed and that you insult me, my husband and the waitress Dayu. We still not understood what happened with your misunderstanding as we have provided what you had requested for. The Bride was very sad of your attitude. Fortunately the Wedding was a great succes, beautiful as always in this amazing ocean of peace that offer MORABITO ART VILLA. "Some people doesn't feel it !" but they are 1/100000000000
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Without any doubt this is one of the most beautiful places that I have ever seen. The most important thing is that this is not only an accommodation, this place is almost a museum.
When you book this Villa is like staying inside the Pascal Morabito’s house. Pascal Morabito is a Jewel designer, poet, sculptor and a complete artist. And sleeping in this spectacular Villa you can see his pieces of art everywhere. 

All the staff in the Villa was absolutely kind with us. They provide us everything that we need. We highly recommend to try their breakfast. They serve it in the terrace close to the beach and I think it was one of the best breakfast in my life.

This Villa has common areas where you can walk around. The garden is absolutely stunning with so many lovely details that you can spend hours only enjoying it. They must have the best gardeners in Bali.
The location of the Villa is perfect. You can see the Sea from your bed! It takes only 1 minute or less from your bed to the beach. And walking through the Beach in only 5 minutes or less you can enjoy beautiful restaurants like “La Antigua” and great Beach Clubs like “Finns”.
This place is WAY MUCH BETTER than in the photos so I absolutely recommend it for your stay in Bali. I definitely will come back again.
title: Best accommodation in Bali

text:
*I am so grateful to have met the beautiful Morabito Family. They are an inspiration not only because they have the most mesmerizing taste in art & antiques but they are a loving family, with integrity and being content - no wonder the place is so magical. Pascal Morabito and his amazing wife, Marie-Eve, are both the definition of 'finesse'. Their graceful style compliments the atmosphere of this hidden gem.  Pascal's talents stretches to the moon and back and a lot of the art has been created or made by him.  The villa will take you to different little worlds, around every corner. You would think for a moment you are seeing something wonderful and the next moment you are engaging in another piece of art or garden arrangement or creative craziness.  Not a dull moment, in fact, you would want to go and just check on a few things again as it was just too good to be true! The collection of art, furniture, sculptures, ornaments, etc etc - will take your breath away - in fact, I have never seen something like this before. 
If you love art, you would think you have landed in heaven. 
If you love antiques, you would be envious, and
if you love nature - you would never ever want to leave. 
The layout of this villa with its architecture and pools and tree houses - deserves an award!
The garden represents a picture perfect setting - almost like it was painted - not sure how it could be done so artistically yet so natural.  And above all, just a little cherry on the cake - you overlook the most incredible beach. The views and sunset are spectacular. I struggle to explain you fantastic it is. Thank you for sharing your place with me. I am honored to have met you. You are my inspiration. Love, Bernadine (Cape Town, South Africa)
title: Nothing can be this beautiful!

text: The Morabito art villa is amazing. The beautiful garden that edges right on the beach (which is one of the best surf spots in Canggu for both beginners and experienced surfers) the pool in the middle of the garden and the creative rooms are all perfect. Wayan and her amazing staff took great care of us. We will definitely be staying here again next time.
title: The best place to stay in Canggu

text:
Absolutely amazing place, we rented it as a 3 bedroom which was over 2 stories on the cliff side overlooking Bingin beach , very well designed with enough room to really spread out, 
There are no shopping centres nearby, if you need alcohol or food you will rely on the wonderful Kadung to do everything for you which he is very happy to do , 
Massages , dinner and transfers were all organised by him and the wonderful ever smiling staff were happy to accommodate,
Only reason I didn't give it a 5 is that I was of the belief there was a restaurant and bar attached but it's an easy thing to get over when you can go down the steep stairs to the beach and eat fresh grilled seafood ,  
Not recommended for elderly people as the steep stairs to the villa entrance would probably prove too much
title: Stunning

text:
I have travelled and stayed in special places all over the world, but never have I experienced anything quite like the Morabito Art Villa! Nestled on the beachfront in Canggu, a great 'up and coming' town, with amazing places to eat, drink and meet good people… this artistic wonderland is a relaxing haven, set in the most magical environment. 

The villa is like a canvas for the owner, an avid collector and artist himself, he creates a rich authentic scene, displaying a dynamic mix, of contemporary and ancient works of art. The space is a true representation of a man who lives to create and my imagination was completely captivated.

I spent my time relaxing by one of the pools - under twisted frangipani trees, I peacefully wondered throughout the grounds of the estate, amongst the rich gardens… I sat on the beautifully manicured lawn with a beer and watched some of the best sunsets I’ve ever seen - slip behind the silhouettes of surfers and disappear into the night. 

I was simply blown away by the rustic luxury of what this rich villa has to offer, I left feeling very renewed and inspired. The Morabito Art Villa for me was not just a nice place to lay my head - but a truely unique experience - I wont soon forget!
title: 'One of a Kind' (Art Museum / Dream / Villa Paradise)

owner_response.text:
Dear Lexi,

Thank you so much for giving us a perfect rating and for recommending Morabito Art Villa to the other travellers. 

Look forward to meeting you again and wish you all the best.

Kind regards,
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

photos.caption: Just one of the many curiosities you'll find

text:
The location is perfect, right on a beautiful beach in Berawa. We choose the King suite, a pure white restful suite very comfortable, elegant decoration with amazing art pieces. We really felt like King and Queen in the middle of paradise. 

The villa owner was very nice, helpful and close. The staff were friendly and smiling all the time. 

You can't go wrong booking this villa for your next vacation, it is beautiful and you don't want to leave. We will surely come back in the future !

Marine
title: A dream vacation in Paradise !

owner_response.text: Dear Marine, thank you for your time writing a review. Your recommendation about the King Suite is really appreciated and we look forward for your next Bali Holidays maybe in an other front beach suite as the Beach House. Kind regards
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Me and my buddies stayed at the Morabito Villa for 3 nights, in the canopy suit, we had such a blast, felt like real billionaires, with the two pools on the second floor, overseeing the flawless gardens lawn, great view of the beach and sunset too, right from the bed. 

It was a very hot period, so it was so nice to have such a large living area with air conditioning. All the walls and every corner of the house is filled with art pieces from the house owner, which are very friendly. Really doesn't feel like an ordinary hotel. The staff was truly caring, and despite some reviews we've seen, the villa is kept extremely clean.

Definitely recommend staying if you've got the chance!

Mike Pans
title: Will come back!

text: I have to admit that I thought I wanted to stay in a typical beach resort on our trip to Bali. My daughter found Morabito Art Villa and loved the idea. She finally talked me into it, but I wasn't sure that I would like it ...... I LOVED it! From the moment we arrived at the airport and were met by Gede to drive us to the Villa, it was a wonderful experience. When we pulled up at the Villa, several of the staff members came out to greet us with chilled towels, smiles, and introductions. The Canopy Suite was better and more unique than I would have ever guessed. We loved the art, the black and white pools, and the fabulous view from the deck. The food was delicious, with breakfast being served downstairs every morning and other meals available with a little notice. The Villa was comfortable, impeccably clean, and quite fun. I'm so glad that I gave in to my daughter's wishes. We had a wonderful time!
title: Wonderful Experience

text:
We had a cousin's wedding reception in Morabito Art Villa. It was beautiful and we enjoyed the reception with beautiful weather. However, there are few safety issues in the room given for bridal suite upstairs. We had a toddler needed a rest and was given the access to the room to rest until reception finishes. It has nice design but safety was a BIG ISSUE in this room. 

First, the stairs has no railing for us to hold. The room upstairs has no indication or whatsoever between the floor and the stairs. So basically, there is a hole for the stairways aligned with the floor, which can NOT be identified and confusion added with the reflection on the mirror as well. 

My mom went to have a look around the room and fell down from the top floor of the room because she stepped on the hole of the stairways. She tried to find something to hold yet there was nothing. It was horrific experience to see her flying and fell down with my own eyes and I was helpless since I hold my active toddler on the bed. My husband tried to help her yet, it was so slippery that he fell down on the floor himself.

Mom knocked her head on the stairs and table that was placed right at the end of the stairs. She had a blackout moment for few minutes and we took her to the Emergency straightaway. Thank God she is unharmed in a very serious way. She had bruises on her head and leg.

I hope that the owner would reconsider the design and add more safety to the room. This can avoid people getting hurt in the future.
title: Safety issues

text:
If you're looking for a low-key but classy wedding venue, this is the place.

Quite average sized garden that can hold 200-300 guests.

They have a very nice artsy setting. Feels almost like an art gallery. Suits its name as an art villa.

And if you're familiar with the name Pascal Morabito.. He owns this place. Literally.
title: Great place for weddings

text: Unless you are heavily into art of any kind and willing to sacrifice everything else then this place is for you. The so called villa is dirty and the rooms are weirdly decorated and very smelly. Just because it is not a FIVE stars francise hotel, it doesn't mean that it has to be dirty and smelly especially when it is not cheap either. I urge the people who go to the website to actually think about it because though the pictures in the website are there but in reality not as nice. But that is just my true opinion speaking from my heart. The towels are old and smell bad. the bed sheets and pillow cases smell bad and the room feels like somebody needs to air it out.I wonder if they ever wash them? I felt soooo uncomfortable and hated every moment of it. Just ruined my holiday and just couldn't wait to get out of there. There are way too many antiques laying around and it just feels like i am borrowing a vila from a friend for free. I don't mind antiques and art collections but if you are renting the place for other people to use, wouldn't hurt to organize them and please clean them!  Yes the beach is there and the pools are there although not exactly clean but othee than that, there is really nothing. The living room is sooo hot and service is slow. Looks like the owner just leaves ALL the responsiblity to a maid to run the whole vila. The so called breakfast is way below average and very slow. In short, I would NOT recommend this vila at all unless...NOT EVER! Especially when there are soo many really nice villas in Bali for that amount of money. the bathroom that i got was old and basically just disappointing in every area. But if you don't believe me, just take a chance and try it yourself. Don't take my word for it. The location is far and not worth at all basically. All you get is just 1 huge old smelly art gallery with  fierce wave on the beach which I can get almost like anywhere in Kuta or Nusa Dua or Seminyak. So NO THANKS for me! Never coming back! Not even for free! At night it is soooo dark that I had to use a flashlight to walk around. very eerie! And there are so many ethic statues laying around practically anywhere so again if you are heavily into that then this is the place for you. Good luck!
title: Horrible Stay!!!

text: Lost far away from the big touristy places of Seminyak, this small boutique place enjoys the most beautiful and peaceful view on the beach. All bedrooms are hidden across a large garden with beautiful decoration. The main "lobby" is a fantastic place for breakfast and dining. Hosts are fantastic. You can do a lot or just stay there looking at the beach for hours. We loved it and wish to go back soon.
title: Heaven on earth

text: Morabito Art Villa is simply, a piece of heaven on earth. The villa is absolutely beautiful with an unblocked view of it own private beach. The staff are exceptional and especially helpful and flexible with our requests. Bedrooms are very comfortable and cosy. They also have wood oven pizzas. You get a sense of peace and calm in the villa. My friends and I had our intended relaxing few days fulfilled at Morabito Art Villa. I would highly recommend the villa to anyone who appreciates the good life and wants a big taste of it.
title: Simply, a piece of heaven on earth.

text:
The Morabito Art Villa is a hidden secret. The perfect get away if you want to decompress.

The gardens and accommodations and use of art in these are amazing.
Every nook and cranny is a beautiful display. Definitely a lot of thought has gone into every detail.  

My husband and I stayed with our 20-month-old baby for 5 days over New Years Eve.

The rooms were stunning, fastidiously clean and the largest bed I’ve ever seen.  There must be a size well beyond King I was un aware of!!

We all loved the pool and exploring the grounds. We were so happy and relaxed here; (massages, manicures all available on request) we barely felt the need to venture into the main strip, (Kuta Beach).

The staff were all great with our son, taking him for walks and playing with him to offer us a little respite at meal times etc, overall I think the Balinese people are inherently very kind and gentle. 

The food and service was amazing. Fresh cooked ala Carte on request and an array of cuisine styles available. I am a coffee aficionado and this was the best coffee I’d ever had. Dare I say but the Balinese coffee well competes with the Italian. Or maybe there is some lineage taking effect here!!

Highly recommend  - We are already planning another visit in August.
title: ABSOLUTELY DIVINE

text: Good place , iam so chill enjoy with the place , and the best place i see ,  to be easy if you wanna looking for sunset , about the foods and drinks its so delicious , i must be come back here , need more days , just 2 days not enough haha
title: Morabito heaven

text:
I had Lunch at Morabito Art Villa,
The Chicken Breast was delicious and you can enjoy the Sunset with good cocktails 
Friendly staff, it’s Amazing
If you come to Morabito You will see lots of antiques from start of entering the villa
Will be back soon guys

text:
it was our first trip to bali which we start & end at morabito art villas.
The word ” art ” has a big meaning at this place and ofcourse can be discussed but it's always a matter of taste.
We booked the place online and we ask for a pickup from the airport, the day after the booking, we got contacted by " whats app ” and the pickup got confirmed.
When we arrived the driver was at the airport on time, all perfect.
We arrived aprox 11:30am at morabito and the staff lady who contacted us by ” whats app ” before, gave us a very warm welcome, the room was already prepared and a breakfast was offered immediately.
We stayed for three nights and had a good time at morabito, staff was very friendly and helpfull, pool was never to busy, pool beds are very big, pool was clean, many restaurants are close to morabito a good place to discover canggu and the surrounding area.
After the first three days at morabito, we discovered bali & lembongan for three weeks and we had a great time, all bali people we met were very friendly & helpfull, great experience!
After three weeks travelling we went back to canggu and we send a request for the same room we booked for our start via “ whats app “ to morabito, five minutes later we got the answer that the same room is available and we are welcome to stay their again.
After we confirmed our return, I ask for a late check out because our departure time was only at midnight, also this request got confirmed from the staff lady without any extra charge and on top, the staff lady organized the airport transfer for free !

All in all; TOP TOP service, great location !
title: First Bali Trip

text:
Super interesting place
We visited Morabito Art and were impressed with the interior / exterior design,  it’s antiques collection. (Wow) 
And the staff were very attentive. 
Very easy to spend a day here

Relax poolside, bar, beach. It’s all here

title: Very unique artistic villa in Berawa

text:
As a ‘Modern Nomad’ and world traveler, Staying at Moribatu is like staying in a creative paradise. 
The location, directly on the beach in Brawa, mixed with Pascal Morabito’s stunning collection of art and artifacts, the unique design ,mixed with the wonderful staff make this a very special place.
I woke to the stunning waterfront view of the ocean the morning surfers. My room has artifacts from around the world and I can see how Damian Hurst was inspired from his stay here. I feel that Damian copied many of these pieces for his 2017 exhibition at the Venice Bienale titled ‘Treasures from The Wreck Of The Unbelivable’.... However, the REAL treasures are here at Morabito .’
- Daniela
title: A Creative Paradise

text:
Returning to one of our favourite destinations (Bali not Morabito), unfortunately the first time we've had a disappointing experience. Can understand why some people might find this place intriguing and unique, but scratch the surface and it is just a rundown sprawling junk yard. The garden is pretty, but our rooms were dirty, our linen was threadbare in places and the room smelled musty and mouldy. The restaurant food was really disappointing but Finns nearby offered an alternative. The pool was grubby, missing tiles around the edge left a nasty cut in my husbands foot and scum around the edges just made us all feel a bit urgh. For the price, there are so many better options.
Staff were helpful but had little initiative.
title: Lower your expectations

photos.caption: unkempt areas in the grounds everywhere.
Pool really needs an upgrade. Husband cut his foot on broken tile and the pool surround was grotty and slimy with scum.
Pleasant views of Canggu beach, but the water is not suitable for swimming, a lot of rubbish and sewage from road drains into the beach.
The pool area was dirty and unattended by staff.
Never seen mould on a dining table before

text:
The Morabito Art Villa is a treasure. A property to which you'll likely never find another that compares. Each suite and individual room is uniquely its own. The environment itself, is unlike any other. 

Don't expect your stay to be hotel like. Morabito is best described as an eccentric homestay. The owner and his family are voracious collectors of art and artifacts; bringing together an expansive assortment of pieces. Such pieces exotically decorate the property, as well as stay housed in the two museum wings. It's an Alice and Wonderland like display of all things out of and down the rabbit hole.

Opposing the space itself, as it's curated, is a natural environment that's fantastic. Bonzai like gardens are well kept and flourish from the start of the property to the sandy Canggu beach front. At high tide, the surf break crashes less than 10-meters the Villa's lawn elevated Bali bed's. Quiet time, a meal, conversation and surfing can all be enjoyed from sunrise to sunset at the villas edge.

Throughout the day, Moribito’s staff tends to the guests and gardens. Making themselves available when needed and offering space when not. The extent to which the property is non-conformant - meaning the staff enjoys no efficiencies, as every room, area, a decoration demands special attention - hints at the dedication and competence of those responsible for the space embody.

My days spent at Moribito were fantastic. I would recommend it to any traveler with an appreciation for things that are unique. For the average tourist seeking common continental comforts, perhaps look elsewhere.
title: One of Bali's most eccentric, unique, and luxurious homestays

text:
I first stumbled upon this gem of a property back in 2017 by chance on Airbnb. There were no reviews and the pictures made it seem too good to be true. 

I booked a two night stay in the King suite and it was absolutely incredible. Since then I’ve been back maybe 10 times and stayed in a number of different rooms/suites. Each of them have their own unique charm. 

It’s a rather large property with only a few rooms so you usually have most of the place to yourself. I’d rather stay here than at some other 5-star resort with hundreds of rooms on the same property. 

Pascal and Marie and the sweetest and they’ve taken great pride in creating such an incredible villa. It’s truly a work of art. 

Any negative reviews you see below are obviously from one group of angry guests that may have gotten into an altercation with the property owners and blew the situation out of proportion with ridiculous complaints. 

If there is any issue with your stay, the manager Wayan is quick to fix whatever problem you experience. 

I’d imagine it’s difficult to maintain such a large property even with all the staff that they have. They really do their best, though. 

If you stay here, you’ll certainly have a lovely time

-Brandon

user_location.name: Taman Nasional Virgin Island, St. John

title: Staying here since 2017

text: The internet can be a fabulous way to research and decide on accommodation when travelling overseas. Unfortunately, it can also be used by owners/management to deceive travellers into believing that their resort is something it clearly is not.  Morabito Art Villas are run down, filthy, and full of safety and health concerns. Cracked tiles, dirty and stained bed linen, rotten wooden stairs, flooded rooms (when the water is running), pool lounges that have seen better days and staff who need better training and direction from management. Coming from an architectural background, I fully understand that art takes many forms and beauty can be admired in many ways. The objects de art strewn throughout this property are objects de junk. There is no style or theme. Rather a large collection of artefacts that could be found in any third world flea market. There are many beautiful resorts to stay in Bali. My advice - stay well away from Morabito Horror Villas.
title: Morabito Horror Villas

owner_response.text:

We don’t specifically closed all those spaces as we imagine the guests understand by themselves that in nearly 1 hectare property, private and storage space have to be respected. 
The art collection exhibited at Morabito Art Villa is at a time located in the suites and outdoor in the garden, wood antiques statues from all Indonesia, stone carving, Toraja Buffalo stone, Sumba statues or idoles, Genuine King House from Kalimantan with the wall of Buffalo skull collection, Bronze statues… yes the art list is long and change every month depends of the sensitivity of Mr Morabito. It’s one of the greatest private art collection in the world.

I recently had the misfortune to stay in this place. Do not be fooled by the glitzy website, it is completely misleading. The grim reality is that is totally unsafe, to get to my room I had to use a spiral staircase with no railing, there were puddles of water on the floor making it very slippery. I had nowhere to hang any clothing, the only space provided wasn’t in my room and was directly under the bathroom above and was flooded daily. The absolute worst was the disgusting state of the villa:run down, musty, full of mould, dodgy taps.

Staff were fine but untrained. This is NOT 5 star accomodation and I write this hoping that no one will have to go through what we did. The place is in dire need of attention and needs money spent in it. The location was the only aspect of the website which was faithful to reality. It really is on the beach.

The place is not secure, there were people wandering around the place. It looked and felt dirty, mould on the umbrellas outside by the pool. Stay here at your peril.

text: A very disappointing stay at Morabito Art Villa, which had billed itself as a five star establishment. It was far from it, instead just a horribly dirty, run down place, that failed to deliver what it had promised.  I am dumbfounded that there are any positive reviews for this place as, objectively, it's grubby and literally falling apart. Wooden stairs crumbling underfoot, cracked, stained bathroom tiles. Health hazards aplenty. Security was also a big issue for us, with random people entering the premises and wandering around, right off the beach. A number of doors did not lock which made several members of our party feel uneasy and unsafe. Do NOT believe the promotional material. There are 100s of amazing, beautiful villas at which to stay in Bali - I recommend that you stay at one of them and beware of this one.
title: Bummed that I have to even give it one star!

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I have been to Bali on numerous occasions and one of the appealing factors that draws me back is the sense of luxury and the ability to spoil yourself with the beautiful hospitality and openness of the Indonesian people.
On this occasion, the website promoted “luxury accommodation in Bali executed with truly unmatched in terms of quality and style. Our team and staff of 25 people make sure keeps you stress free, exceed your expectations and leave you and your guests with unforgettable memories.”
With the images and video shown on the website I was so excited and as you can see by my images very quickly disappointed.  Top luxury to me is not a property that is dirty, dark and furnished with filthy broken furniture. It does not have sewerage smell that even the staff think is bad, times without running water, cold showers or a hand basin with a water trickle. Showers shouldn't drain into swimming pools!
Top luxury accommodation has staff who are welcoming, trained in hospitality, a turndown service and provide bottled water when the local water is undrinkable. In this case there were less staff than guests and that is not what was promoted.
I did leave with unforgettable memories and that was due to the lovely friends that I was travelling with and absolutely nothing to do with this accommodation.

***Owner was given the opportunity to respond to our feedback and complaints but had conveniently left the country for her staff of 5 to deal with the misrepresentation themselves. I do feel for them as a team is only as good as its manager.

***I recommend you look at all of the traveller photos instead of the owner ones as this property is misrepresented. Whilst staying at the Morabito Art Villa I never saw some of the features listed on Tripadvisor - what minibar? Gym/Fitness centre? Spa? Room service? Concierge? Golf course? Laundry service? 

***Learn from my experience and don't stay here ever
title: Not my preferred choice for top luxury accommodation

title: Luxury

text:
Morabito Art Villa, located North of Kuta is a state of art property, home to and designed by world famous architect Pascal Morabito. This Indian ocean facing property, is one of the top luxury accommodation in Bali.

Value for Money - 4 out of 5
Location - 4.2 out of 5
Staff Friendliness - 4 out of 5
Unique Quotient - 4 out of 5
ExploresterStay Category - Luxury
ExploresterToDo - Enjoy the sunset at Morabito Beach Club.
Explorester Recommends - 4.1 out of 5

Room :
We stayed here for 3 nights and booked the Canopy suites. We had a 2 bedroom suite to ourselves with 2 private swimming pools with a huge living area. The suite was decorated with innumerable, most exotic art pieces.

Both bedrooms face the porch outside with the 2 private swimming pools and then is the beach thereafter.

Food :
The in-house  Morabito Beach Club is an amazing place to spend your day and their Pesto Spaghetti is a must try. Breakfast is in the same restaurant. Again the Coffee is a must try. Good breakfast. No buffet but you can order from a set menu.

Staff :
A team of only 25 people manage this place. Pascal Morabito’s Wife, Marie was herself there and she was very sweet and welcoming.

Property Overall :
This is a place that will exceed your expectations. Perfect location and close to the happening areas of Kuta and Legian. Amazing property just at the beach and also good for surfing.

Tips :
- Do spend atleast one evening in the beach club to witness one of the best sunsets in Bali.
title: Perfect Luxury in the island of Gods! - Morabito Art Villa (Canggu)

text: Delicious food, unique atmosphere, comfortable  and a beautiful view!  The dinner tables are different colors and styles. There are places to sit on the grass and other spots in a tree. The service is excellent. We came twice because it was so nice!!!

title: Wedding

text:
Just spent 10 days in Paradise, otherwise known as  the Morabito Art Villa. Now  back in Europe and slowly coming down to earth.....I soooo miss the beautiful Majapahit Suite (our own private house ! ) with its enormous bed romantically draped in white, its perfect blend of ancient and contemporary 'objets d'art' and lovely garden area. The main house, where we had breakfast every day, was equally thrilling - a sophisticated and modern artist's environment , filled with such creativity and originality that it made other places we visited in Bali seem quite dull and old-fashioned. 
 Our hosts were delightful, the service impeccable, and the beautifully-maintained gardens, leading straight to the beach, were breathtaking.  While we were staying, a couple came by to arrange their wedding at the Art Villa and we thought " if our stay is any indication what an extraordinary start to a marriage".  
Whatever....marriage, holiday, general hanging- out and having fun  - this place is a 'must' !
title: The Beautiful Majapahit Suite

text:
We have lived the most magical week of our lives in Morabito Art Villa. Our wedding week shared with our family and friends in this magical place and environment. From the stunning views, to the incredible architecture with beautiful Art Pieces this Villa is absolutely unique. All our guests were amazed by the venue and mentioned repeatedly "what a dream location!" 

Thank you to Pascal and Marie Eve Morabito for creating this heaven and this unforgettable week!
title: Heaven on earth

text:
Yes, I suppose I am biased being the bride that planned the wedding with Morabito Art Villa, but I have the agreement of all of my wedding guests to vouch for me!
My husband and I have had a long and magical romance with Morabito Art Villa which started when we stumbled across it's eclectic beach house and natural bath pools on the edge of the beach at Berowa, Canggu over four years ago. Intrigued we decided to scale the banks of the beach to see what else was behind the enchanting wooden property, a scene that we will always remember- a stunning green garden filled with frangipani and palm trees, with hundreds of pieces of art in monument, statue or small garden stone designs lining the property and encouraging us to look further, a serene pool surrounded by Lilly lined moats and Mexican & Balinese carvings.  With no one around we vowed to find out more about the place and return -"that is the place I want to get married in" I urged, my boyfriend for once actually agreed...we left happy and full of romance. When we returned to Australia we hit the net to find out more and loved learning about the history, run by a French artist and his family. We returned to Bali two years later where my boyfriend organised a surprise 2 night stay at Morabito and proposed on the beach under a palm lined Bale...so the wedding was the logical next chapter. I engaged with Marie-Eve for all of the planning and she was amazing with her recommendations and speedy and hospitable service . We hired the whole villa for 17 of the bridal party for three nights , prior during and post the wedding.  So we got to really experience the place, everywhere you look there is a framed photo opportunity with the fantastic artistic design by Morabito, you are truly amongst a living  masterpiece, it's not a traditional Balinese villa which makes it so special for a wedding and a private family gathering.  All the rooms are unique and have a story but are also of five star comfort and cater for children ,we had 4 under 1year olds staying.  The wedding itself was beyond all of our expectations, the managers and staff shone and every tiny piece of planning ran seamlessly thanks to the support of the villa and their recommended vendors.  We had the wedding catered by Morabito's kitchens too and the food was spot on. The ceremony was out on the lawn with the beach as the backdrop and we had Balinese dancers and musicians adorning the garden for the guests arrival. As sunset arrived hundreds of tiny lanterns lit up the frangipani lined tables and the villa became like a scene from a fairy tale.  Not only was it spectacular it was so much fun, the staff ensured this and everyone was so happy from start to drunken pool swimming finish! :) Morabito art villa will remain stead fast in our hearts for ever and we hope to return to Bali every year for anniversary and stay at the villa. The Sleet Family.
title: The Most Beautiful Wedding ever!

text: We stayed there for a wedding and it was magnificent. The location is absolutely perfect, a little slice of heaven right on the beach. The garden and pool area are amazingly maintained, the food was excellent however quite pricey for Bali and so were the spa treatments. We were a group of 18 people staying there at the same time (the villa was rented exclusively for us) however the place was so spacious and offered great privacy that we never felt overwhelmed. The staff was very helpful and were very on hands. They also organised the wedding which was absolutely beautiful...
title: Fabulous place to stay

photos.caption: Garden lights for the wedding night
Canopy suite on top of the reception and dining area

text:
When you walk through the doors of this property you are instantly transformed
. 
Not only are the grounds immaculately kept and the property is located in a sublime position, but the perfect placement and interesting artefacts around this boutique hotel, just keep you constantly amazed and inspired.

The kindness and hospitality of the hosts Pascal,Maryeve,Teo, Tao and their staff are well beyond what is expected. They are extremley warm, very welcoming and genuinely interested in making your experience relaxing and individual. 

Our holiday was both  amazing and uniquley different  from any  Balinese holiday we have ever taken. We definatley will be back.
title: Tranquillity

text: Ich war auf der Suche nach einem Hotel direkt am Strand. Was mich erwartete war kein Hotel und ist schwer in Worte zu fassen- es eröffnete sich ein Blick mitten ins Paradies, in einer völlig anderen Welt. Ein Ort gefüllt mit so vielen Fundstücken aus aller Welt verzaubert und vereint zu einem Ort der Ruhe und Lebendigkeit, Inspiration, Romantik, Leichtigkeit,  einem sprechenden Platz der vereinten Welten von einem Schöpfer der besonderen Art. Danke für diesen Augenblick
title: Amazing Paradise

text:
Je recommande vivement cet endroit complètement hors du commun ! 
Situé a proximité des endroits sympas mais bondés comme Finns, vous y trouverez un lieu calme et reposant a la décoration particulièrement charmante (idéal pour les shootings et photos instagram). Les propriétaires sont toujours au petit soin avec nous et nous les remercions vivement pour les petites attentions qui nous font revenir a chaque fois. Vous pouvez séjourner dans la Morabito Art Villa mais également venir y passer la journée, vous prélasser au bord de la piscine, ou des petits bains (mon endroit préféré), face a la plage des surfeurs. On a l'impression de se retrouver a la maison, et quelle maison ! Nous sommes tout le temps heureux de revenir et cela depuis l'année dernière, que cela soit en famille ou avec des amis. 
Petit conseil, dépêchez vous de vous y rendre avant que l'endroit soit pris d'assaut ce qui ne saurait tarder au vu de la beauté du lieu.
title: Un endroit idyllique qui reflète bien Bali

text: Morabito Art Villa a juste tout ce dont on peut rêver pour séjourner à Bali. Face à la plage et aux surfeurs, un écrin de calme et de verdure ou le calme vous rappelle le Bali d'avant que tous les clubs de plage avec musique et bière n'envahissent la côte. Des collections d'art incroyables (je dis bien "des" collections), des chambres sublimes, un service très sympathique. Que demander de plus pour des vacances en Indonésie ?
title: Le Paradis ...

photos.caption: Les baignoires dans lesquelles on prend l'apéritif en admirant le coucher du soleil

text: Nous avons tout d’abord pris un apéritif entre amis dans cet endroit calme reposant  et surtout magnifique ! On passe une petite porte et l’on y découvre un bijou ! Nous avons pu discuter quelques instants avec mr et mme Morabito qui sont des gens abordables ! Ils nous ont conseillés de revenir goûter à leur poisson en croûte de sel ! La découverte de cet endroit nous a donner l’envie de revenir y savourer ce poisson ! Donc chose faite quelques jours après le  poisson en croûte était excellent sans compter l’apéritif et surtout le personnel à nos petits soins ! La période calme a fait que nous étions que nous au milieu de ce petit paradis nous avons pu nous y baigner ...Je le conseil vivement et les prix sont corrects
title: Une endroit reposant somptueux

text:
Un très bel endroit sur la plage, fait plutôt rare ici à Bali !
Mon meilleur ami a organisé son mariage dans cette maison/musée à ciel ouvert ! Entre la maison en elle même, le cadre et le couché de soleil il n’y a simplement rien à rajouter !
title: Un beau mariage

text:
abbiamo scoperto questo posto incantevole dove trascorrere una piacevole giornata di relax sulla spiaggia.
staff accogliente location molto curata e buon cibo
nella struttura sono disponibili anche delle camere che non ho avuto occasione di vedere 
consiglio vivamente di provare questa esperienza lontano dalla folla e dal caos
title: relax sulla spiaggia

text: Toevallig kwamen we langs het beachhouse Morabito. Bedjes gehuurd en de hele dag genoten van uitzicht, perfecte service heerlijk (Franse) lunch en de prachtige kunstzinnige tuin.  De kunstwerken in de tuin geven je het gevoel in een museum te zijn. Aanrader!
title: Dagje aan het strand bij Morabito

text:
nous avons diner dans cet endroit surprennant, sous les etoiles, eclaire par la lune. Il y a beaucoup de lieux sur la mer a bali, mais aucun n egale Morabito art villa. L art est present dans chaque detail, la beaute s est invitee partout, Jusque dans les assiettes.
Si vous passez par Bali, reservez une de vos soirees afin d y passer un moment, je vous garantis un moment inoubliable
title: stunning place in brawa beach

text: Tout est étonnant et somptueux , foisonnant , sobre et excentrique , en transformation . Puis un restaurant de gout  français provençal, un délice ! La mascotte : chat  majestueux regne sur le domaine .
title: Une Oeuvre d "Art en perpétuelle evolution sur les vagues de Canggu

text:
Estuvimos alojados toda la familia en el Hotel y la experiencia no pudo ser mejor.

Hotel elegante con pocas habitaciones pero todas muy originales y elegantes.

El propio Pascal Morabito nos atendió personalmente para enseñarnos su casa, explicarnos como realiza sus obras etc...

Una experiencia única en un enclave mágico!

Todo un acierto!!!
title: Precioso y elegante

text: Комплекс вилл, где огромная территория даст полное ощущение, что вы отдыхаете без чужих людей. Владелец виллы очень адекватный и идёт на уступки в решении различных вопросов. Есть свой выход к океану.
title: Огромная территория.

text: Après avoir passé près de trois semaines dans ce lieu envoûtant il est difficile d'en dire du mal. Rencontre humaine surprenante et merveilleuse qui ne s'oublie pas de si tôt. Le cadre et l'esprit vivant de la villa vous transporte dans une ambiance autant chaleureuses que mystérieuse. On en a pas fini d'en voir jour apres jour, tout cela dans des espaces créés avec minutie et recherche où l'a peu près n'existe pas. Je ne remercie jamais assez l'accueil et la bienveillance qui nous ont suivie tout au long de notre séjour. Marie-Eve, Pascal Morabito ainsi que leur équipe sont des personnes qui ne vous laisse pas indifférent et chez qui, une fois partie, il tarde d'y revenir et d'y retrouver la magie qu'ils vous offrent.
title: Admiration et magie

text:
Magnifique maison / oeuvre d'art
Décoré avec beaucoup de gout.
Attention les petites chambres ne vallent pas le prix (heureusement nous avions été surclassés car les suites étaient dispos)
Personnel très agréables.
Pas forcément adapté avec des petits enfants (cf les oeuvres d'art et bibelot dans les chambres)
Parfait pour se reposer
Emplacament idéal face à la plage et le site animé de Canggu est facilement accessible en taxi.
Un bar animé juste à coté sur la plafe très sympa pour sortir également
Seul bémol : cher pour Bali...
title: Cadre privilégié et magnifique en bord de plage

text:
C'est là où deux esthètes ont posés leurs valises avec une vision unique de ce que serait dix ans après un lieu atypique dont le concept avant-garde mêle l'Art, l'Art de vivre et le vivre ensemble. Véritable expérience sensorielle qui ouvre d'autres perceptives, offrant une perception inédite de Bali. Marie-Eve et Pascal Morabito vous accueillent à Canggu dans un décor éclectique où chaque chambre est un cabinet de curiosité où sont mis en scène les pièces collectées par Pascal au fil des années mais également ses propres créations. Mais si l'envie vous prend de quitter la ville pour la côte sauvage, rendez-vous à Bingin à la MORABITO ART CLIFF, autre lieu autre concept. Chaque suite porte le nom d'un lieu: Santorin, New York, Paris. Le designer a là encore réalisé une véritable prouesse technique en domptant la falaise et en faisant des contraintes géologiques un véritable atout montant son hôtel en terrasses offrant au fur et à mesure des étages des points de vue différents à couper le souffle. 
De plus Marie-Eve propose également à la location ces deux lieux pour des cérémonies uniques. Imaginez vous marier à l'autre bout du monde où tout est pensé pour que ce soit à jamais votre plus beau jour!
title: MORABITO ART VILLA Parenthèse enchantée

text: Dès notre arrivée nous avons eu un accueil chaleureux de la part du personnel et surtout des propriétaires Pascal et Marie Eve. Nous avons passés un séjour de rêve, d'abord avec le temps 28°C jour et nuit, très supportable grâce à la clim. dans un décor magnifique parmi une collection d'objets reflétant la culture indonésienne et de sculptures créées par Pascal. La nourriture balinaise est un régal, je vous recommande le "mie goreng" un plat de légumes cuits à la vapeur, de viande, avec des pâtes asiatiques disposées en forme de nid et un oeuf mollet posé dessus. La piscine très agréable en bord de la plage ou l'eau de la mer est elle aussi à 28°C. Et alors, passer Noël et Jour de l'An en short et tee shirt est un vrai bonheur. Faire le réveillon du Jour de l'An dans le jardin en pantalon de toile et chemisette est inoubliable. Nous sommes restés à Morabito Art Villa 3 semaines du 15 décembre 2015 au 9 janvier 2016. Nous y retournerons.
title: Les fêtes de fin d'année à Bali

owner_response.text: Cher Jacky, ce fut un grand plaisir de vous recevoir avec votre famille à Morabito Art Villa, nous vous souhaitons de très agréables fetes de fin d'années et espérons avec toute l'équipe vous revoir pour un autre séjour à Bali.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Everything is perfect there : location on the best beach of Bali, the rooms, the incredible decoration with peace of art, the owners nice and warm, the beautiful swimming pool, the garden ...
Highly recommended !

La villa est exceptionnelle par sa localisation sur la plus belle plage de Bali, sa décoration exceptionnelle, ses oeuvres d'art merveilleuses et variées disséminées dans le jardin et les chambres (que le propriétaire Pascal Morabito pourrait vous céder si vous le demandiez), le raffinement de chaque chambre et la qualité de l'accueil et de l équipe chargee de devancer tous vos désirs.

Les chambres sont immenses, uniques et décorées avec gout et soins, les salles de bain luxueuses et parfumées, l'immense piscine fait face à la mer, le jardin tropical est un havre de paix dérangé uniquement par le bruit des vagues qui s'écrasent sur la plage à perte de vue ...

Bref une merveille à la hauteur de nos attentes. 

Recommandée sans hésiter une seconde !
title: Amaizing place

text: Un musée à ciel ouvert dans un cadre parfaitement entretenu qui donne sur une plage de rêve. La piscine de coraux est tout simplement à tomber et le jardin réserve de multitudes de surprises à découvert au grès de vos errances.
title: Splendide

text: La Morabito Art Villa est une pure merveille décorée avec passion et goût par le designer français Pascal Morabito. Chaque pas dans ce "musée" privé est un pas dans le temps, dans l'histoire indonésienne ainsi que l'occasion de faire des photos magnifiques... La King House du Roi Pontianak à Kalimentan trônait autrefois sur une rivière. Reconstruite à l'identique dans le jardin, ses fondations se reflétant dans un bassin de nénuphars, elle fait aujourd'hui face à la mer et vous pouvez y savourer de délicieux repas sur une table de marbre chinoise, en profitant de l'air marin et de la vue des surfs, kites et paddles. La Beach House de l'autre côté de la piscine, petite maisonnette sur pilotis au bord de l'eau est l'un des lieux les plus romantiques que j'ai vu et au coucher du soleil la magie s'opère vous laissant sans souffle devant la beauté de l'instant. Il en est ainsi pour toutes les pièces de la villa, c'est un lieu où l'artiste réalise ses rêves pour vous en faire profiter, un lieu unique aux hôtes généreux et au personnel gentil dans lequel se relaxer, surfer et savourer sont les maîtres mots. Je recommande donc à tous ce lieu de vacances incontournable.
title: Quand vos rêves deviennent réalité !

text: emplacement unique bord de mer ambiance chic et familiale decor balineen hotes d'exception
title: paradisiaque

text:
Hôtel vraiment magnifique dans un cadre paradisiaque : un pur moment de bonheur. Nous avons passé 10 jours inoubliables dans cette villa où les amoureux d'art premier indonésien seront comblés. Les suites luxueuses et très spacieuses sont meublées avec des bois précieux importés des quatre coins du monde, les baignoires sont creusées à même la pierre et tous les jours agrémentées de fleurs balinaises par le personnel discret et très attentionné.
La cuisine préparée par les cuisiniers balinais formés par des chefs français est excellente. Le matin nous avions droit aux croissants, pains aux chocolat et financiers tous chauds et délicieux. Nous prenions nos repas face à la plage à perte de vue sur la mer. Le personnel s'est mis en 4  pour nous concocter des excursions et des ballades dans des endroits peu touristiques où nous avons pu découvrir le vrai Bali !
title: Séjour inoubliable dans un cadre époustouflant

text: Un lieu unique où l'on vous accueille avec gentillesse et plaisir , et où tout est fait pour que bonheur soit le maitre mot de votre séjour.
title: Un coin de bohneur
